content: प्रसवः {@--1@} Begetting, generation, procreation, birth, production. {@--2@} Child-birth, delivery, confinement; as in आसन्नप्रसवा. {@--3@} Offspring, progeny, young ones, children; <ab>oft.</ab> at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>; केवलं वीरप्रसवा भूयाः <ls>U. 1</ls>; <ls>Ku. 7. 87.</ls> {@--4@} Source, origin, birth-place (<ab>fig.</ab> also); <ls>Ki. 2. 43.</ls> {@--5@} Flower, blossom; प्रसवविभूतिषु भूरुहां विरक्तः <ls>Śi. 7. 42</ls>; नीता लोध्रप्रसवरजसा पांडुतामानने श्रीः <ls>Me. 65</ls>; कुंदप्रसवशिथिलं जीवितं <ls n="Me.">113</ls>; <ls>R. 9. 28</ls>; <ls>Ku. 1. 55</ls>; <ls n="Ku.">4. 14</ls>; <ls>Ś. 5. 9</ls>; <ls>Māl. 9. 27</ls>, <ls n="Māl. 9.">31</ls>; <ls>U. 2. 20.</ls> {@--6@} A fruit, product {@--7@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Extracting Soma juice. {@--8@} Setting in motion. {@--9@} A current, stream. {@--10@} Excitement, animation. {@--11@} Enjoining, ordering {@--12@} Assistance, help. {@--13@} Pursuit, acquisition.
